result.execSummary:
The defendant Rene A Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: *Huber privileges for work and 4 days credit.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
*Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
*COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
*Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.
*No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

timeConds.notes:
*SERVE 90 DAYS at the House of Correction commencing by noon on 11-2-15 with work release for work, school and treatment and counseling. 
*Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rene A Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction with Huber privileges for work and 4 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) maintain employment; 7) obtain GED; 8) SERVE 90 DAYS at the House of Correction commening by noon on 11-2-15 with work release for work, school and treatment and counseling. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Rene A Garcia in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information recieved and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  On motion of the State, Court AMENDS the charge to Possession of Cocaine - 2nd and Subsequent Offense 961.41(3g)(c) a Class I felony.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Positive drug test.  Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Rene A Garcia in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Zachary A Wittchow for Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has a new charge pending in Br. 22.  Attorney Wineke would like time for further negotiations for possible global resolution.  COURT WILL NOT TRANSFER THIS CASE TO BR. 22.  Court states this case will remain in this court for resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Rene A Garcia in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Rene A Garcia in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has a new case and it is set for preliminary hearing on 8-11-15.  Parties move to adjourn.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Rene A Garcia in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/6/2015 at 1:30, branch 44.  Court ordered defendant to go to Justice Point on Monday, July 7, 2015.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Rene A Garcia in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Paul Hauer for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/11/15.

Defendant is Public Defender eligible.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Br 3  Status conference scheduled for 05-27-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rene A Garcia in court.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Defendant's mother was just evicted, and defendant was not working to help mother move items into storage.  Defendant requests more time to obtain a lawyer.  Court grants adjournment.  Defendant to bring in pay stubs or attorney at next court date.  Case adjourned for indigency hearing on 5/18/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rene A Garcia in court.  Marissa Santiago for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant was not able to retain counsel for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Indigency Hearing before Judge Fiorenza Br. 03.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rene A Garcia in court.  Megan Carmody for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant informs the Court that he is retaining Attorney M. Plaisted to represent him. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
